p: To further verify our hypothesis, we evaluated the antiviral efficiency of oseltamivir against SARS-CoV-2 in vitro as described in the previous work [24], [25]. Fig. 5 A showed that treatment of oseltamivir did not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 replication, with half-inhibitory concentration (IC50) value above 100 μM. Chloroquine was selected as a positive control, which can inhibit SARS-CoV-2 replication ( Fig. 5B). Therefore, we concluded that oseltamivir is ineffective against SARS-CoV-2.
